alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, west central Rock, northern Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Littleburg to 13 miles southeast of Valentine to near Valentine National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Springview, Long Pine, Johnstown, Norden, Wood Lake, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, North River Trail, Sparks, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Smith Falls State Park, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge and Antelope Peak. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 209 and 253. Highway 83 between mile markers 181 and 189. Highway 12 between mile markers 8 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock
